item.title: OpenWrt Router on Pi 3
item.description: I’ve successfully configured OpenWrt Router on my Raspberry Pi 3, enhancing customization for my application needs. The process involves selecting the appropriate Raspberry Pi image, inserting the SD card, and configuring OpenWrt settings. After adjusting LED configurations and network interfaces, I added static leases for Kubernetes nodes. Following a reboot, I reconfigured my Kubernetes Cluster due to IP changes. Troubleshooting involved handling missing wireless menus and resolving issues with Jenkins caused by taints. Now, my Raspberry Pi serves as a versatile OpenWrt Router seamlessly integrated with my Kubernetes Cluster.
